channel.title: Making a webclient - Jarring
channel.description:
I am making a webclient, but I am failing at jarring it. [img]http://i625.photobucket.com/albums/tt332/zs4yswtf/Helpmeplease.png[/img]
That is what it looks like in Jar maker, but when I open the client it says. "Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit."
I'm not expert in clients, so I would really appreciate some help so I can use this for future reference.

item.title: Making a webclient - Jarring
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

Make sure you have the input to the file where all the CLASS files are not java. If not create a new file and put all your class files in in (With no .bat files etc.) If you still struggle post a DL link to your client (Without cache and extras) and i will make you a .jar file.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient - Jarring
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Did you sign your client? maybe you have a outdated version of java.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient - Jarring
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

sw3ldn:

okay our problem is output…set it as desktop…not desktop>junk>etc…just desktop

Err… No it isn’t.
Make sure not to have the .bat file selected in jar maker.
What revision are you using?
If your client has a src and a bin folder, select the bin folder.
Basically select where all the class files are.
Jar maker doesn’t care for .java

Read full topic
